message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.DB

This paper focuses on a specialized text extraction task for the financial domain, specifically extracting mentions of names of financial institutions from financial prospectus documents. This task involves Named Entity Recognition (NER) and Entity Resolution (ER), which are well-studied topics in natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

The paper also involves the use of specialized knowledge, i.e., lists of financial institution names, to develop a rule-based approach for NER and ER. This aspect of the paper could fall under sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which covers topics related to search engines and information retrieval systems, and cs.LG (Machine Learning), which covers topics related to machine learning and data mining. 

Additionally, the paper involves the creation of specialized dictionaries for financial institution names, which could fall under sub-categories such as cs.CY (Computers and Society), which covers topics related to social and ethical issues in computing, and cs.DB (Databases), which covers topics related to database systems and data management. 

Overall, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL, followed by cs.IR and cs.LG, with cs.CY and cs.DB being less likely but still relevant.
